title: Voyagers of Mars: The First CHAPEA Crew’s Yearlong Journey
summary: When the first humans travel to the Red Planet, they will need to know how to repair and maintain equipment, grow their own food, and stay healthy, all while contending with Earth-to-Mars communication delays. They must also find ways to build comradery and have fun.  The first all-volunteer CHAPEA (Crew Health and Performance Exploration Analog) […]

title: YPSat’s view from Ariane 6
summary: If there had been an astronaut aboard the historic first launch of Europe’s Ariane 6 launcher, this is what they would have seen: images and videos from key phases of the flight were captured by the YPSat payload, a project led and undertaken by ESA Young Professionals in their own time.

title: NASA’s Hubble Traces Dark Matter in Dwarf Galaxy Using Stellar Motions
summary: The qualities and behavior of dark matter, the invisible “glue” of the universe, continue to be shrouded in mystery. Though galaxies are mostly made of dark matter, understanding how it is distributed within a galaxy offers clues to what this substance is, and how it’s relevant to a galaxy’s evolution. While computer simulations suggest dark […]

title: Mpemba effect at Concordia
summary: Freezing boiling water in Concordia against the sunset

title: Booz Allen Ventures invests in space tech startup Quindar
summary: Quindar developed an IT platform for automating satellite operations

title: The Exploration Company Completes Wind Tunnel Testing for Mission Possible
summary: The Exploration Company has completed the wind tunnel test campaign for its next subscale demonstrator, Mission Possible. The demonstrator is slated to be launched aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 in the first half of 2025. Mission Possible is The Exploration Company’s second subscale demonstrator of its modular Nyx spacecraft. The demonstrator capsule has a diameter […]

title: Attention Civil Servant Retirees
summary: NASA’s Glenn Research Center civil servant retirees are invited to attend the 2024 Summerfest!  Wednesday, Aug. 7, 11 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.   Along Taylor Road at Lewis Field  For more information or to RSVP, contact Kathy Clark at 216–433–8354 or kathy.m.clark@nasa.gov  Registration closes: July 26

title: Chinese commercial rocket firm suffers 4th launch failure
summary: Chinese commercial rocket outfit iSpace suffered a launch failure late Wednesday in a fresh setback for the company.

title: Butch and Suni Confident Starliner Can Bring Them Home Safely
summary: The two NASA astronauts who are flying the Boeing Starliner Crew Flight Test said today they are fully confident that the spacecraft can bring them safely home. Butch Wilmore and […]
